Base.Explanation: Access an object in Active Directory. The action is used always in combination with other subsequent actions. Once the object is found, an internal data structure representing the object is setup. This structure is stored in a variable (%ActiveDirectoryObject%) that can be used by other actions.

ArrayElement.Name: LDAP name
ArrayElement.Description: The full LDAP name of the Active Directory object. (example: LDAP://SERVER_A/cn=John Williams, ou=Schools, dc=Tools4ever, dc=Com).

ArrayElement.Name: Active Directory object
ArrayElement.Description: An internal data structure representing the object. This property is an 'output only' property and is generated automatically when the object is found in Active Directory. This property can be used in other script actions.

ArrayElement.Name: Relative name (output)
ArrayElement.Description: The object's relative name. Example: 'CN=GroupA'. This property is an 'output only' property.

ArrayElement.Name: Class name (output)
ArrayElement.Description: The name of the object Schema class. Example: 'user'. This property is an 'output only' property.

ArrayElement.Name: Active Directory path (output)
ArrayElement.Description: The Active Directory path of this object. The string uniquely identifies this object in a network environment. The object can always be retrieved using this path. This property is an 'output only' property.

ArrayElement.Name: Parent AD path (output)
ArrayElement.Description: The Active Directory path the parent container that contains this object. This property is an 'output only' property.

ArrayElement.Name: Schema AD path (output)
ArrayElement.Description: The Active Directory path of the Schema class object of this object. This property is an 'output only' property.

ArrayElement.Name: Unique object identifier (output)
ArrayElement.Description: The globally unique identifier of the object. This property is an 'output only' property.

ArrayElement.Name: SID (output)
ArrayElement.Description: The SID (security identifier) of the object. An error is generated if this property is specified an the Active Directory object has no SID. This property is an 'output only' property.

ArrayElement.Name: LDAP name

Base.Explanation: Create a directory on a remote or local computer. The directory can be the 'Home' or 'Profile' directory of a user account or any other directory that must be created. Optionally, you can specify directory permissions and share the directory.

ArrayElement.Name: Computer
ArrayElement.Description: The name of the computer (example: SERVER_A) on which the directory must be created. Together with the 'Parent Path' property this property defines the parent directory of the directory that must be created.

ArrayElement.Name: Parent Path
ArrayElement.Description: The path of the parent directory on the specified computer. The parent directory is the directory in which the new directory is to be created. The 'Parent Path' can be specified as a share name (example: USERDATA) or as a logical path (example: G:\Users) of the specified computer. In the latter case, an administrative share (example: G$) is used to access the parent directory.

ArrayElement.Name: Directory name
ArrayElement.Description: The name of the new directory (example: 'John'). The name of the directory is the last part of the full path of the directory. In case the home directory for a user account is specified, the name often equals the name of the user account (%UserName%).

ArrayElement.Name: Always create unique directory
ArrayElement.Description: If the directory already exists, the application can add a number to the directory name to make it unique (specify 'Yes'). If you specify 'No', no directory is created if the specified directory already exists.

ArrayElement.Name: Error if directory exists
ArrayElement.Description: If the directory already exists, the action fails and returns with an error. IF you have specified the option 'Always create unique directory' this situation cannot occur.

ArrayElement.Name: Security
ArrayElement.Description: The security settings of the new directory. The security settings include all of the permissions and the owner of the directory.

ArrayElement.Name: Share the directory
ArrayElement.Description: Once the directory is created, the directory can be shared by creating a share on the directory.

ArrayElement.Name: Share name
ArrayElement.Description: The name of the share that is used to create a share on the new directory. If a share with the same name already exists, a number is added to the share name until the share name is a unique name.

ArrayElement.Name: Share permissions
ArrayElement.Description: The permissions of the share (!) of the new directory. If this property is not specified, the default settings apply.

ArrayElement.Name: Share comment
ArrayElement.Description: A comment about the shared folder. The comment can contain any text and is an optional field.

ArrayElement.Name: Error if share exists
ArrayElement.Description: If the directory is shared (property 'Share the directory' set to 'Yes') and this property is set to 'Yes', an error is generated if the share already exists. If set to 'No', an incrementing number is added to the name of the share until it is unique.

ArrayElement.Name: Share user limit
ArrayElement.Description: Specifies the number of users who can connect to the shared folder at one time. If this property is not specified, the number is set to unlimited.

Base.Explanation: Set the group memberships for Active Directory object. The Active Directory object can be any object that can become a member of the specified groups, e.g. a user, other group, contact etc. The Active Directory object can be specified by a variable or an object distinguished name.

ArrayElement.Name: Active Directory Object
ArrayElement.Description: A data structure representing the Active Directory object for which the group membership is updated. To specify the object, you must use this property or property 'Active Directory LDAP name'. If you use this property you must specify a variable for which the value is generated by another action.

ArrayElement.Name: Active Directory name
ArrayElement.Description: The name of the Active Directory object for which the group membership is updated. To specify the object, you must use this property or property 'Active Directory Object'. If you use this property you must specify the object disinghuised name of the Active Directory object. Example: cn=Group123,ou=Ou32,dc=tools4ever,dc=com.

ArrayElement.Name: Group names (variable)
ArrayElement.Description: The names of the groups of which the Active Directory object must become a member. Each group name must be specified by its full LDAP name. The value of this property can only be specified by a multi-text variable.

Base.Explanation: Set the group memberships for Active Directory object. The Active Directory object can be any object that can become a member of the specified groups, e.g. a user, other group, contact etc. The Active Directory object can be specified by a variable or an object distinguished name.

If you use this property you must specify the object disinghuised name of the Active Directory object. Example: cn=Group123,ou=Ou32,dc=tools4ever,dc=com.

ArrayElement.Name: Group names (variable)
ArrayElement.Description: The names of the groups of which the Active Directory object must become a member. Each group name must be specified by its full LDAP name. The value of this property can only be specified by a multi-text variable.
